turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Juan de Vaca.
turn.2: Juan de Vaca  Juan de Vaca (also "Juan de Baca") (died 1565) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Panamá (1561–1565).
turn.3: What did you find most interesting about him?
turn.4: Juan de Vaca was born in Valladolid, Spain and ordained a priest in the Order of Saint Benedict.
turn.5: What did he do as Bishop of Panama?
turn.6: On January 27, 1561, Pope Pius IV, appointed him Bishop of Panamá and he was consecrated bishop on February 8, 1562.
turn.7: What else did he do in his lifetime?
turn.8: He served as Bishop of Panamá during the governorship of Luis de Guzman and successfully organized a counter-revolt against Rodrigo Méndez who seized the city during the governor's absence.
turn.9: Did he recieve any awards for his work?
turn.10: He was also credited by the townsfolk with miraculously halting an expansive fire in 1563 by leading a procession with the Blessed Sacrament directly to the heart of the fire which was then shortly thereafter extinguished.
turn.11: How long did he serve as Bishop of Panama?
turn.12: He served as Bishop of Panamá until his death in 1565.
